alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Cleveland; Custer; Grady; Kingfisher; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 1:37AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kingfisher, Grady, eastern Caddo, southwestern Oklahoma, east central Custer, northwestern Cleveland, southern Blaine, Canadian and northwestern McClain Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 136 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Fay to near Cogar to 5 miles southeast of Anadarko. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Western Oklahoma City, El Reno, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Anadarko, Watonga, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Warr Acres, Tuttle, Piedmont, Hinton, Union City, Minco, Geary, Okarche, Hydro and Dibble. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 91 and 144. Interstate 44 between mile markers 69 and 106. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Cleveland; Custer; Grady; Kingfisher; McClain; Oklahoma
